mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle E_{LP/UP}(k_{||})=\frac{1}{2}\left[E_{X}({k_{||}})+E_{C}(k_{||})%
\mp\sqrt{\Omega^{2}+\delta^{2}(k_{||})}\right]" display="inline"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>P</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mi>U</mi></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>X</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>∓</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mrow><msup><mi>δ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext: The coefficients, $X(k_{||})$ and $C(k_{||})$, are called the exciton and cavity Hopfield coefficients \cite{Hopfield1958} and are given by
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E4.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\hat{P}_{k_{||}}" display="inline"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub></msub></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E4.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=X(k_{||})\hat{a}_{k_{||}}+C(k_{||})\hat{b}_{k_{||}k_{||}}" display="inline"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub></msub></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi>C</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><mrow><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E5.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\hat{Q}_{k_{||}}" display="inline"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>Q</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub></msub></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E5.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=-C(k_{||})\hat{a}_{k_{||}}+X(k_{||})\hat{b}_{k_{||}}." display="inline"><mrow><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>C</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub></msub></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi>X</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: The coefficients, $X(k_{||})$ and $C(k_{||})$, are called the exciton and cavity Hopfield coefficients \cite{Hopfield1958} and are given by
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E6.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle|X(k_{||})|^{2}" display="inline"><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mrow><mi>X</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E6.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=\frac{1}{2}\left(1+\frac{\delta(k_{||})}{\sqrt{\delta^{2}(k_{||}%
)+\Omega^{2}}}\right)" display="inline"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><msqrt><mrow><mrow><msup><mi>δ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt></mfrac></mstyle></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E7.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle|C(k_{||})|^{2}" display="inline"><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mrow><mi>C</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E7.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=\frac{1}{2}\left(1-\frac{\delta(k_{||})}{\sqrt{\delta^{2}(k_{||}%
k_{||})+\Omega^{2}}}\right)." display="inline"><mrow><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><msqrt><mrow><mrow><msup><mi>δ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt></mfrac></mstyle></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: where $g = 2$ is the spin degeneracy factor of polaritons, $m$ is the effective mass of polaritons, $S$ is area of the field of view, and $E_{max}$ is the upper bound of the energy limit collected by the objective lens. We also computed the polariton number in the field of view by directly summing up the CCD count per second multiplied by the appropriate conversion factor, namely
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E8.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle N_{fit}" display="inline"><msub><mi>N</mi><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>i</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></msub></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E8.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=\frac{gmS}{2\pi\hbar^{2}}\int_{0}^{E_{max}}N(E)dE" display="inline"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">ℏ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mn>0</mn><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></msubsup></mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>E</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mi>E</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext: where $N_i,\tau_i$ and $M_i$ are the CCD counts per second, the lifetime of the polariton state, and the density of $k$ states at pixel $i$. $\xi$ accounts for the overall optical efficiency of the collection setup, including the loss in the dispersive grating and the quantum efficiency of the CCD. We define the goodness of fit as
prevtext: where $g = 2$ is the spin degeneracy factor of polaritons, $m$ is the effective mass of polaritons, $S$ is area of the field of view, and $E_{max}$ is the upper bound of the energy limit collected by the objective lens. We also computed the polariton number in the field of view by directly summing up the CCD count per second multiplied by the appropriate conversion factor, namely
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E9.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle N_{int}" display="inline"><msub><mi>N</mi><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></msub></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E9.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=\sum_{i}\frac{N_{i}\tau_{i}}{\xi M_{i}}" display="inline"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mi>i</mi></munder></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>N</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>ξ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

prevtext: where $N_i,\tau_i$ and $M_i$ are the CCD counts per second, the lifetime of the polariton state, and the density of $k$ states at pixel $i$. $\xi$ accounts for the overall optical efficiency of the collection setup, including the loss in the dispersive grating and the quantum efficiency of the CCD. We define the goodness of fit as
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E10.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle gof" display="inline"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E10.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=\frac{N_{fit}^{c}}{N_{int}^{c}}" display="inline"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msubsup><mi>N</mi><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>i</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mi>c</mi></msubsup><msubsup><mi>N</mi><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mi>c</mi></msubsup></mfrac></mstyle></mrow></math>

nexttext: where $N_{int}$ is determined using Eq.~(\ref{sum_CCD}), and the temperature and chemical potential in $N(E)$ are taken from the fitted values of Bose-Einstein distributions. The polariton population beyond the upper bound $E=20$ meV of the integration is negligible. The black line is a fitted linear relation. The difference is negligible compared to Fig.~5 in the main text, which is not surprising because of the fits to the Bose-Einstein distribution fall on top of the data at all temperatures. Compared to Fig.~\ref{phase_diagram}a, the proportionality is improved because of the inclusion of polariton populations at high energies which are outside of our field of view.
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E11.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle N_{tot}" display="inline"><msub><mi>N</mi><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>o</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></msub></math>
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E11.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle=N_{int}+\frac{gmS}{2\pi\hbar^{2}}\int_{E_{max}}^{E=\textrm{20 %
meV}}N(E)dE" display="inline"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><msub><mi>N</mi><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">ℏ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mtext>20 meV</mtext></mrow></msubsup></mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>E</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mi>E</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>
